content.body: Hm, in our pre-meeting Waldemar is objecting to Stage 2 advancement since we don't even actually have initial spec text, just a vague mostly-empty sketch.

heads up: waldemar is gonna object to us having special treatment of the "literal identifiers" (infinity, undefined, NaN, maybe null?)

content.body: I don't believe we should change anything - I think our current grammar is the best - but just saying.

content.body: (The only alternative that could work is eliminating literal matchers entirely, and relying solely on interpolation patterns to match against literals - always having to write `when({foo: ${1}})`, for example.)
